Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Compared to homopolymer P6 , all copolymers P1-P5 exhibit red - shifted absorption and emission spectra in solution and in film and smaller bandgaps.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| homopolymer P6 |
| copolymers P1 |
| copolymers P2 |
| copolymers P3 |
| copolymers P4 |
| copolymers P5 |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| homopolymer P6 |
| copolymers (P1, P2, P3, P4, P5) |

Explanation:
The original paragraph mentions "homopolymer P6" and "copolymers P1-P5". Since "copolymers" is a general term for a type of polymer, I have grouped all the copolymers under one entry with the label "copolymers (P1, P2, P3, P4, P5)" to maintain precision.

Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Compared to homopolymer P6 , all copolymers P1-P5 exhibit red - shifted absorption and emission spectra in solution and in film and smaller bandgaps.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| absorption spectra in solution |
| absorption spectra in film |
| bandgaps |
| red-shifted |
| emission spectra |

These entities are identified based on the context of the paragraph. The copolymers P1-P5 have red-shifted absorption and emission spectra and smaller bandgaps compared to homopolymer P6. Therefore, the properties mentioned in the paragraph are the absorption and emission spectra in solution and in film, as well as the bandgaps, all of which are described as being red-shifted.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| absorption spectra in solution |
| absorption spectra in film |
| bandgaps |

These entities are identified based on the context of the paragraph as they are clearly material properties mentioned in the paragraph. The copolymers P1-P5 have red-shifted absorption and emission spectra and smaller bandgaps compared to homopolymer P6 in both solution and film states. Therefore, the properties mentioned in the paragraph are the absorption and emission spectra in solution and in film, as well as the bandgaps, which are material properties that describe the behavior of the copolymers regarding light absorption and emission.
